alert.note: Alert for Eastern Greenbrier; Summers; Western Greenbrier (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 11:25PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Greenbrier and northeastern Summers Counties through MIDNIGHT EDT... At 1124 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southeast of Summersville to Rainelle to 10 miles west of Dry Creek. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Rainelle... Rupert... Quinwood... Renick... Sandstone... Falling Spring... and Asbury. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
